page.description: Get the table associated with an object.
page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.TABLE_GET() Syntax &ltTBL> as P = &ltOBJECT>.TABLE_GET() Description The &ltOBJECT>.TABLE_GET() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Browse Columns (for &ltOBJECT> use the address of the column or a pointer to the column)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form)
Form Controls (for &ltOBJECT> use the address of the control or a pointer to the control)
Fields (for &ltOBJECT> use a pointer to the field) The &ltOBJECT>.TABLE_GET() method returns the &ltTBL> object pointer to the table that contains the data referenced by the &ltOBJECT> object pointer. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example This script returns the name of the table for the field pointer " fld ". dim tbl as P dim fld as P dim table_pointer as P dim table_name as C tbl = table.current() 'get a pointer to the first_name field fld = tbl.first_name.this table_pointer = fld.table_get() table_name = table_pointer.name_get()
Example dim tptr as P tptr = Customer_Information:browse1.Table_Get() ? tptr.name_get() = "CUSTOMER"
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
